description: This SNMP trap is generated when a peripheral goes online.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralOnlineTrap AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralUnitNum.3 i 9 AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralName.4 s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum u 9 AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: This number will correspond to the unit number of the peripheral
device.
variables.name: AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralUnitNum

description: The name of the discovered peripheral.
variables.name: AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralName

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap
sequence number when it sends traps and it must notify the CLC
via a window transaction after each trap.
When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: This SNMP trap is generated when a peripheral goes offline.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralOfflineTrap AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralUnitNum.4 i 9 AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralName.5 s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum u 9 AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: This number will correspond to the unit number of the peripheral
device.
variables.name: AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralUnitNum

description: The name of the discovered peripheral.
variables.name: AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralName

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap

When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence

variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: This SNMP trap is generated when a configured external peripheral unit goes online.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiExtPeripheralOnlineTrap AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiExtPeripheralUnitIndex i 9 AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiExtPeripheralUnitManagedPeripheral s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum u 9 AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: This index will correspond to the unit number of the external
peripheral device.
variables.name: AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiExtPeripheralUnitIndex

description: The name of the managed peripheral.
If the device has been discovered, this string matches the
aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralName of the discovered device.
variables.name: AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiExtPeripheralUnitManagedPeripheral

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap
sequence number when it sends traps and it must notify the CLC
via a window transaction after each trap.
When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: This SNMP trap is generated when a configured external peripheral unit goes offline.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiExtPeripheralOfflineTrap AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiExtPeripheralUnitIndex i 9 AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiExtPeripheralUnitManagedPeripheral s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum u 9 AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: This index will correspond to the unit number of the external
peripheral device.
variables.name: AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiExtPeripheralUnitIndex

description: The name of the managed peripheral.
If the device has been discovered, this string matches the
aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralName of the discovered device.
variables.name: AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiExtPeripheralUnitManagedPeripheral

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent

When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence

When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap

The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: This SNMP trap is generated when an external peripheral is discovered.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredTrap AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralIndex i 9 AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralName s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum u 9 AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each discovered
external peripheral device.
variables.name: AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralIndex

description: The name of the discovered peripheral.
variables.name: AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralName

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent

When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.

When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: This SNMP trap is generated when a discovered external peripheral is forgotten.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralForgottenTrap AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralIndex i 9 AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralName s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum u 9 AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each discovered
external peripheral device.
variables.name: AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralIndex

description: The name of the discovered peripheral.
variables.name: AIPERIPHERAL-MIB::aiPeripheralDiscoveredPeripheralName

variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime
